thread.title: Eddie Vedder says young Cubs don't care about history
thread.title_full: Eddie Vedder says young Cubs don't care about history | Chicago Sun-Times

title: Eddie Vedder says young Cubs don't care about history
text:
On a night the Cubs spent nine innings partying – mostly hitting – like rock stars it seemed fitting that Eddie Vedder was there from batting practice to Dexter Fowler-long-ball finish.
The Pearl Jam front man and lifelong Cub fans has been following this postseason ride since last week in Pittsburgh when the Cubs clinched the historic matchup with their century-plus-old rivals from St. Louis.
“Cubs-Cards for me is Fergie Jenkins against Lou Brock or Bob Gibson knocking down Jose Cardenal with an inside pitch,” said Vedder, who called the postseason matchup “good for the game” – even before the Cubs pounded the Cardinals 8-4 on a clear, warm thunderous October night.
“That’s why it’s such a great game, because there’s a sense of history,” he said. “But at the same time, I believe this Cub team doesn’t care about the history, and that’s what’s exciting about it.
“It’s a brand new day.”
